name: Denilson Barbosa 0001
content: Denilson Barbosa Denilson Barbosa (he/him/his) is a Professor of Computing Science at the University of Alberta. Denilsonâs research interests are in knowledge management, information retrieval, and natural language processing, and applying machine learning methods in these fields. He has supervised graduate-level research on the problems of named entity recognition, typing and disambiguation; open relation extraction; understanding social processes in Wikipedia article authoring; mining citation networks; and semi-structured data management. Denilson regularly teaches databases, natural language processing, and information retrieval. Denilson was the President of CAIAC â the Canadian Artificial Intelligence Association between 2023 and 2024. NOTE: Grad school applicants seeking my support should read this page. Contact in person: Office: ATH 4-51 e-mail: denilson@ualberta.ca phone: 780-492-2285 Denilson Barbosa Department of Computing Science 2-21 Athabasca Hall University of Alberta Edmonton, Alberta, Canada T6G 2E8 I am slow to respond to email. For urgent admin matters, please reach out to [csea@ualberta.ca].
